import java.awt.*;
import.awt.event.*;
import javax.swing.*;
import javax.swing.event.*;

public class ReadFile extends JFrame{
    
}

/**   private JTextField addressbar;
    private JEditorPane display;
    
    //constructor
    public ReadFile(){
        super("RSPS Browser");
        
        addressBar=new JTextField("typeyourrspsurlhere")
        addressBar .addActionListener(
                new ActionListener(){
                    public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent event){
                        loadCrap(event.getActionCommand());
                        
                        
                        
                    }
                }
    };
    add(addressBar, BorderLayout.NORTH);
    * 
    * display=new JEditorPane();
    * display.setEditable(false);
    * 
    * }
    *

I changed the code to his current code but it was error-free, He has modified it and is now getting an error, maybe
he needs a GUI tutorial or something.

item.title: Java help
item.dc:creator: @dclawed dclawed
item.description:
@dclawed wrote:


It comes up as error, and says this: Class ReadFile is public, should be declared in a file named ReadFile.java 
Tried doing public class ReadFile.java extends JFrame

Any help?

Also, could anyone help me and fix the errors on this?

  [code]package JavaApplication2;
import java.awt.*;
import javax.swing.*;
import javax.swing.event.*;

public class ReadFile extends JFrame{
    
        
private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
private JTextField addressbar;
private JEditorPane display;

public ReadFile(){
        super(Browser");
       
        addressbar=new JTextField("typeyourrspsurlhere");
        addressbar.addActionListener(null);{
                }
        }
                public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent event){
                        loadCrap(event.getActionCommand());
                }
                private void loadCrap(String actionCommand) {
                       
                       
                }
               
                void add(){
                display=new JEditorPane();
                display.setEditable(false);
                display.addHyperLinkListener(
                        new HyperLinkListener(){
                            public void hyperlinkUpdate(HyperlinkEvent event){
                               if(event.getEventType()==HyperlinkEvent.EventType.ACTIVATED){
                                   loadCrap(event.getURL().toString());[/code]

It comes up as error, and says this: Class ReadFile is public, should be declared in a file named ReadFile.java
Tried doing public class ReadFile.java extends JFrame

Any help?

Also, could anyone help me and fix the errors on this?

[code]package JavaApplication2;
import java.awt.;
import javax.swing.;
import javax.swing.event.*;

public class ReadFile extends JFrame{

private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
private JTextField addressbar;
private JEditorPane display;

public ReadFile(){
super(Browser");

    addressbar=new JTextField("typeyourrspsurlhere");
    addressbar.addActionListener(null);{
            }
    }
            public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent event){
                    loadCrap(event.getActionCommand());
            }
            private void loadCrap(String actionCommand) {
                   
                   
            }
           
            void add(){
            display=new JEditorPane();
            display.setEditable(false);
            display.addHyperLinkListener(
                    new HyperLinkListener(){
                        public void hyperlinkUpdate(HyperlinkEvent event){
                           if(event.getEventType()==HyperlinkEvent.EventType.ACTIVATED){
                               loadCrap(event.getURL().toString());[/code]
